name: Wild Dunes Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just came back from this resort with a very good feeling. When we checked into the one bedroom villa that we initially book, we found renovations going on in units on each side. No problem, we saw the manager, Jonathan, and before you could say low country crab cakes...we were upgraded to a wonderful 3 bedroom villa at their Beach Club, which couldn't have made us happier! The villa had outstanding views of the ocean and the whole resort was peaceful and relaxing. I would not hesistate to spend time here with friends and family. It is for all age groups with plenty of activities on the Island. If you get restless then Charleston, SC is a 20 min. ride so don't hesitate to enjoy Wild Dunes...the management will make it special!
reviews.title: Smooth sailing once our villa was changed

likes.disliked: — initially the unit we booked was next to others being renovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Boardwalk Inn was very nice. Staff was helpful, friendly and courteous. The resort itself is like a small city. If you have a family and want convenience at a nice resort, this is the place. If you're looking for a more quiet private getaway it might be a little more busy than you're looking for. Great place.
reviews.title: Very nice but busy

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and many services available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I would like to say I am an avid non-complainer. I am a happy person and truly find the positive in almost every situation. This is not my first time to write a review, however, it is my first time to write a negative one.
reviews.title: A non complainer....definitely complains!!!!

reviews.text: I planned a special weekend for my fiance and I at The Boardwalk Inn at Isle of Palms. I read several reviews and thought it would be a wonderful getaway. I went to the hotel's webpage and made reservations. I even called a few days before just to make sure everything was ready for my special weekend. I was assured it was.
reviews.title: Terrific resort - teenage son loved it!

reviews.text: Upon arrival we were met by a very nice bellman. I was excited. I went in for check in and was met by yet another very polite receptionist, given a brief description of the layout, and our keys. I had reserved an Ocean Deluxe Room for around $300 a night. After reading some reviews, I was prepared for a minimal ocean view, however after getting to our room, I was completely disappointed. Not only did the room smell but the only view was the parking lot. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, I called the front desk and asked them to please move us to a room more like I had reserved. The initial room wasn't anything like what I had reserved, two full beds and a VERY small bathroom.
reviews.title: A Great Resort Gone Bad!
Non-disclosure of Beach Restoration - BEWARE!
reviews.text: Just got back from a long Memorial Day weekend at Wild Dunes, and can only suggest, DO NOT STAY HERE without getting very specific information from the resort regarding the Beach Restoration project currently on-going. That is, unless you're okay with having the beach entirely dug up in front of your villa, and having 5-10 bulldozers running along the beach at all hours of the day and night.

We'd booked a premium room at Shipwatch, and upon arrival, it was nothing like we'd anticipated. The building itself was filthy, as was the room, with towel racks hanging off the walls, broken door stops, dated/tired looking linens and towels, cigarette ashes on our balcony, etc. A complete mess, not to mention our oceanfront room had an obstructed view and our beach access point was closed.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect until checkout

likes.disliked: — Only one bathroom however I did officially only have a one bedroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After going up the management chain at the front desk after being repeatedly told "there's nothing we can do" we were offered a better room at Mariner's Walk. Then, we woke up the next morning to find the entire beach bulldozed 200-300 yards in each direction which they'd not informed us of when switching rooms. Not exactly convenient with young children to walk around the roped-off construction zone to get to the unaffected beach area, let me tell you.
reviews.title: Mother's Day Weekend at Wild Dunes!! WONDERFUL!

likes.liked: — The screened lanai overlooking the beach
likes.disliked: — Our unit was kinda outdated...not that it made a big difference, but 80's style needs updating.

reviews.title: What a great week!
reviews.text: We spent another 1-2 hours on the phone that morning with the front desk and were able to get a minimal reduction of our rates, but suffice it to say, the complete non-disclosure of what would actually be occurring on the beach in front of us was a tremendous disappointment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been coming to Wild Dunes for many, many years and love the resort. However, this experience has soured us to the point of possibly never returning.
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

likes.disliked: — ocean view obstructed by townhouses built in front

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Charleston for a friends wedding. We decided to go a few days early and stay at the beach before heading downtown. We had heard great things about Wild Dunes so we decided to give it a try. Overall, we had a very good experience. There were a couple of things that could be improved upon but nothing the ruined our vacation and would prevent us from returning again.
reviews.title: Very happy, overall

reviews.text: The good --
reviews.title: Great Value, Location & Amenities - The Villages

likes.liked: — Everything needed within a short walk. No reason to leave resort.
likes.disliked: — I liked everything. Nothing really put a damper on this trip.

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms and bathroom are very large. We loved the fact that our room had a table/desk with 2 chairs so we could eat dinner at a table when we ordered room service.
reviews.title: not like it used to be

likes.liked: — We liked that we had a balcony and we were pool side
likes.disliked: — the carpet was coming up and the room was never clean

reviews.title: Family vacation at Wild Dunes
reviews.text: We tried 2 restuarants in addition to room service while we were at Wild Dunes - Edgars on the Links and the Sea Island Grill for lunch. Both were very good. Edgars is a sports bar so they have all the typical sprots bar food - sandwichs, wings, etc. The Sea Island Grill was very good as well. Both restaurants and room service had very reasonable prices.
The beach has just been restored and is huge! Is is very wide with lots of stuff going on.
reviews.title: spacious and well-equipped
Very comfortable and open
reviews.text: I really liked this resort. The condominiums were more open and comfortable than a hotel. The service was great also. If you book at this resort, may sure you request a unit with unobstructed views. Our balcony unit was on the end and was blocked by concrete walls. Most of the other balconies had a much better view. I LOVE to sit out on the balcony and b/c of the obstructed view, I could not enjoy that luxury. Also, our unit was directly above the work-out facility. You could hear weights dropping all day and evening and it sounded like thunder. You could also hear the music. Other than these two annoyances, it was a great overall experience. These units are not directly on the beach and you can't see the beach from them, but the walk to the beach is a nice one.

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: We stayed in room 101VG. I think this was a new unit. (Our building was to the right of the check in area and it was a turquoise and yellow building.) Everything in the unit looked brand new and in great condition. The only problem we had was actually locating the unit we were supposed to stay in. The signage is definitely lacking. One other complaint was the fact that you had to use your room key to operate the elevators, yet you did not need a key at all to open the doors if you walked up the steps to access the building. Using the key to operate the elevators was a bit over the top in my opinion and downright a pain in the butt. Other than that, there were no complaints. (Well, except for the bulldozing at all hours of the day, but that seems to be severely poor planning on the part of the City of the Isle of Palms, not Wild Dunes Resort.) I was pleased with our stay and would consider it for future vacations.

reviews.title: One of Our Best Vacations in Recent Years
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Charleston area and we were drawn by the location of the resort and its proximity to Charleston, as well as the information provided on the Wild Dunes website. We booked Beach Club Villa #66 (I will go into details on the unit later) through the Wild Dunes rental office. The reservationist assured me that the Beach Club Villas was what she reserved for her family and friends who came to visit. She personally recommended unit #66.

reviews.title: Mixed Experience
reviews.text: I would highly recommend renting through Wild Dunes directly as it gives you free access to the Grand Pavillion pools, Boardwalk area, Swim Center pool. etc., without the fees that are imposed even if you have a "Sportscard" that comes from renting through individual homeowners. We spent lots of time at the Grand Pavillion and Swim Center, so for us it was worthwhile to not pay the extra $$.

reviews.title: Great Oasis
reviews.text: Wild Dunes far exceeded our expectations. We did not expect to have such a beautiful, large resort for our enjoyment. There was so much available to us and we only took advantage of some of the things offered. It was like being in a large hotel resort but while staying in your own home. We had daily maid service to change out our towels and take out our garbage. Midweek, they came and changed out the linens and made all of the beds. On the down side, upon check-in, the cleaning staff was still cleaning the unit and needed an extra 30 min. A bit of an inconvenience but not too bad. The free shuttle system was a bonus! We had one car between the 5 adults and 2 kids, so it was nice having free rides within the resort and to the Marina outside the resort. We used it extensively and they were VERY prompt. We tipped each time.

aka: Wild Dunes Hotel Isle Of Palms
